findings.title: Proper Logic in LockRewards::withdrawLocked()
findings.description: The issue stems from the lack of boosted amount calculation when the staked assets are removed.

findings.title: Accommodation of Non-ERC20-Compliant Tokens
findings.description: The `transfer` function does not follow the ERC-20 standard, specifically it does not throw an exception when the message caller's account balance does not have enough tokens to spend.

findings.title: Timely updateReward() Upon the rewardRate Change
findings.description: The rewards may not be accrued using the right rewardRate if the call to updateReward() is not immediately invoked before updating the new rewardRate.

findings.title: Inconsistency Between GuStableCoin And Xau
findings.description: The `GoldRoom` protocol has two built-in fractional-algorithmic stablecoins `Gu` and `Xau`. Our analysis shows that these two stablecoins share the same logic, but have unnecessary inconsistency in their implementation.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the GoldRoom protocol, there is a privileged `owner` account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating system-wide operations. It also has the privilege to control or govern the flow of assets managed by this protocol.

findings.title: Incorrect Trading Fee in UniswapV2Library
findings.description: The UniswapV2Library contract has an incorrect assumption of a 0.3% trading fee instead of the actual 0.25% trading fee used by PancakeSwap, which may skew token conversion calculations.

findings.title: Simplified Logic of Pool::availableExcessGrDV()
findings.description: Precision loss may occur due to different orders when both multiplication and division are involved in the `Pool::availableExcessGrDV()` function.

findings.title: Improved Sanity Checks For System Parameters
findings.description: DeFi protocols typically have a number of system- wide parameters that can be dynamically configured on demand. The `GoldRoom` protocol is no exception.
